subject: Art & Design
title: Fallingwater: A House Over a Waterfall
description: Learn Fallingwater: A House Over a Waterfall in one minute.

hook.text: Frank Lloyd Wright built a house directly over a waterfall. Not beside it. Over it. You hear water beneath your feet.

buildup.text: The Kaufmann family wanted a house with a view of the waterfall. Wright gave them one that became the waterfall.

discovery.text: Cantilevered concrete trays extend over the stream without visible supports. The house floats above nature.

twist.text: Engineers warned the cantilevers would fail. They sagged within years. Structural repairs continue to this day.

climax.text: Despite structural issues, it's considered the best example of organic architecture â€” building as part of landscape.

punchline.text: Wright didn't place a house in nature. He made nature part of the house.

quiz.question: What makes Fallingwater an example of organic architecture?
options: The building integrates directly into the natural landscape over a waterfall
It's built entirely from organic materials
It generates its own electricity from the water
